results.title: Energy everlasting
results.brief_description: Everyone knows that oil won’t last forever. The search for new forms of renewable energy is increasing. This film looks at some of the ways that are being used to explore the options available. In Indonesia and the Phillipines photo voltaics provide electricity for homes. In Sweden, biomass and hydroelectricity play an increasing role, and in other parts of the world, wind and wave power are playing their part. The costs of these systems are as yet untested in a harsh fiscal world but, in the next thirty years, some of these fledgling technologies will come more and more to the fore.

results.title: Energy efficient light
results.creator_credit: John Hipwell, Mark Poole, Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria and Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as one of a series of videos commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria, this video looks at ways commercial building owners, operators and managers can save energy and the environment. This episode looks at lighting consumption and illumination, lamps, lighting and luminairies. Control systems are explored as well as effective strategies for improving the efficiency of existing systems and energy efficient alternatives.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Energy management in commercial buildings”.
Designed as one of a series of videos commissioned by the Commonwealth Department of Primary Industries and Energy and the Gas and Fuel Corporation of Victoria, this video looks at ways commercial building owners, operators and managers can save energy and the environment. results.title: Energy Conservation in the Home
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Energy conservation in the home” provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

See also Related Title 325491 “Victoria’s energy”; uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

results.title: Energy and work
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Part of the “Physical science study committee series” presents experimental evidence that the work done on a body, measured as the area under the force-distance curve, is a measure of the transfer of kinetic energy to the body calculated from its mass and velocity. Dorothy Montgomery demonstrates the relationships using mechanical devices.

results.title: Energy and work
results.creator_credit: Larry Trust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Defines energy, potential energy and kinetic energy. Shows how energy is expounded and stored and how energy can be changed from one form to another. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Energy and models (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies”.
Electric and magnetic interaction demonstrate the S.C.I.S. learning cycle - exploration, invention discovery. The use of a higher process of “model” in science employing a link between the use of black box and electric current is demonstrated

results.title: Energy and matter
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, ONF | NFB and Robert Verrall
results.brief_description: A look at energy and what it is, designed to encourage understanding and experimentation among even the youngest of budding physicists. This film pictures energy in familiar forms - light, heat, motion, etc. - and shows its origin in the sun. The illustration is cartoon-style, with color and movement appealing to youthful imaginations.
